qas.question: What was used to hide debts?
Swaps allow Greece to do what?
What other country hid its debt through swaps?
What can legally be overcome with swaps?

context: According to Der Spiegel credits given to European governments were disguised as "<a0_0>swaps<a0_0/>" and consequently did not get registered as debt. As Eurostat at the time ignored statistics involving financial derivatives, a German derivatives dealer had commented to Der Spiegel that "<a3_0>The Maastricht rules<a3_0/> can be circumvented quite legally through swaps," and "In previous years, <a2_0>Italy<a2_0/> used a similar trick to mask its true debt with the help of a different US bank." These conditions had enabled Greek as well as many other European governments to <a1_0>spend beyond their means<a1_0/>, while meeting the deficit targets of the European Union.
